section.title: CVS
section.para: The best way to keep your CDK libraries up to date is to use Concurrent Version System. Linux/Unix distributions include this software. Other users may have to find a client for their platform on the internet (or download one of the packages below).
Information about how to get the CDK source code from CVS at SourceForge can be found here.

section.title: Packages
section.para:
To use the CDK you need to download the cdk-libs package that contains required libraries that are used by CDK. A binary distribution is available in cdk-bin, and the source code can be found in the cdk-source package. Packages cdk-source
Source code. To compile the source code you need cdk-libs 20020206. Current version: 20020518.
cdk-libs
Set of required and optional libraries (more info). Current version: 20020206.
cdk-bin
Binary distribution with two executables: cdk-fileconvert and cdk-dbadmin. The package is installable with configure && make && make install on Linux/Unix/BSD like systems. To run the software you need cdk-libs 20020206 installed. Current version: 20020518.
cdk-test
Binary distribution with one executable: cdk-test. It is used to run JUnit tests for CDK. The package is installable with configure && make && make install on Linux/Unix/BSD like systems. To run the software you need cdk-libs 20020206 installed. Current version: 20020419.
cdk-doc
Contains the JavaDoc of the library. Current version: 20020518.
